faqItems.question: Is it really free?
faqItems.answer: Yes! NextShip is MIT licensed and completely free to use, even for commercial projects. You get the full source code and can modify it however you want.

faqItems.question: What's included in Priority Support?
faqItems.answer: Direct access to the creator via email, priority responses to bug reports and feature requests, help with implementation, and general guidance on building your SaaS.

faqItems.question: Can I use this for client projects?
faqItems.answer: Absolutely! The MIT license allows you to use NextShip for any purpose, including commercial client work and your own products.

faqItems.question: Do I need to pay for updates?
faqItems.answer: No, all updates are free forever. When you clone the repo, you get access to all future improvements and features at no cost.

faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions

items.question: What is NextShip?
items.answer: NextShip is a production-ready Next.js starter template that includes authentication, payments, security, and all the essential features you need to launch a SaaS. It's MIT licensed and free to use.

items.question: Is this really free?
items.answer: Yes! NextShip is completely free and open source under the MIT license. You can use it for personal projects, commercial products, and client work without any restrictions.

items.question: What's included?
items.answer: Authentication (Supabase), payment processing (Stripe/LemonSqueezy), enterprise security (Arcjet), database (PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM), email integration (Mailgun), modern UI (shadcn/ui), and much more. Check the Features section for the complete list.

items.question: Do I need coding experience?
items.answer: You should be comfortable with React and Next.js. NextShip is a starter template, not a no-code solution. It saves you setup time but assumes you know how to build features.

items.question: What are the service costs?
items.answer: Most services have generous free tiers: Supabase (free tier available), Stripe (pay per transaction), Arcjet (free tier), Vercel (free for personal projects). You can start with $0/month and scale as you grow.

items.question: Can I customize it?
items.answer: Absolutely! You get the full source code and can modify anything. Remove features you don't need, add new ones, change the design - it's yours to customize.

items.question: How do I get updates?
items.answer: NextShip is a starter template, so you clone it once and own your copy. You can pull updates from the repo if you want, but your project becomes independent after cloning.

items.question: Is it production ready?
items.answer: Yes! NextShip includes enterprise-grade security, error handling, and best practices. Many developers have launched products with it. However, you should still test thoroughly and review the code for your specific needs.

items.question: What payment providers are supported?
items.answer: Both Stripe and LemonSqueezy are pre-configured. Stripe is better for US-based businesses with complex needs. LemonSqueezy is easier to set up and handles global taxes automatically.

items.question: Do you offer support?
items.answer: Community support is available via GitHub discussions. Priority support with direct access to the creator is available as a paid add-on.
